title: Ahri is up to 54% WR with 20% playrate. Can we have a reasonable discussion yet?
body:
http://champion.gg/champion/Ahri/Middle

Every single thread about this is the exact same. Ahri players insist she's completely fine and bombard the thread and anyone who disagrees with downvotes. This is exactly like when Riot gave Sona that ~~metric shit ton of buffs on one patch~~ 'mini-rework' and Sona mains claimed she was completely fine when she was completely broken. I'm not saying Ahri is at that level of OP, but she needs some minor tuning.

But we can't even have a discussion about it because of the people who play Ahri absolute **refuse** to compromise. If a champion like Zed had similar numbers, the boards would be going completely apeshit. Just saying.

Edit: It's not close to 2 and a half years yet, I could've sworn 5.2 came out in January. Had to check to be sure.

Sure seems like it. 

I made a reasonable thread yesterday that was actually sort of defending her and every single Ahri player told me she was fine and I was wrong. One of them even called me a whiny idiot.

https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/tudQOGEE-the-only-change-ahri-needs

I feel like...I'll go out on a limb and say _half_ of the people who don't want the Q speed gone need the safety net of mobility creep to stay alive in lane because they're awful and can't hit skillshots, so they depend on the Q to keep themselves from feeding. That's why I've been pushing for a revert, and recently, a _partial_ revert of the season 5 rework to return some amount of skill in playing her.  

Without the Q speed, you'll be punished for spamming, vulnerable pre-6 again, and her win rate will drop from the bad players who can currently get by with spamming abilities and running around like an idiot not having their extra, unnecessary speed - I guarantee it. Meanwhile, the good, or at least practiced Ahris won't be affected as much.  I won't say she won't need changed again, but if she's in the "too weak" category, I'd think only SLIGHT damage buffs would be enough.

I just hate the "Ahri isn't strong, everyone else is just weak" argument used, lol. It's like a permabanned toxic player complaining everyone made them toxic.

Ahri is certainly not broken or extremely frustrating, but there is no denying that a majority of players, irrespective of skill level, enjoy a large rate of success with her, to the point that Ahri only has a sub50% winrate against Annie.

The answer isn't in nerfing Ahri's itemisation and/or buffing every other mid laner, but almost certainly in reviewing Ahri's profile of strengths and weaknesses.
Even so if everyone else is weak that makes Ahri strong lol. Strength is completely relative to other champions, that's literally what balance is.

Compared to champions that just can do it on command - {{champion:31}}, {{champion:161}}. Not to mention Ignite, a common summoner spell for mid laners that contains %TD and GW.

Personally; I feel that the explicit change to cause Charm to not stop stoppable dashes is the biggest thing that makes this intolerable--

That she now has a standard utility (cast spell to move fast) instead of a unique one (stop dashes before they complete).

The damage amplification on Charm gave her a more assassin-styled pattern; and the changes that were made were made with the mindset of making her less of an assassin (or so the notes claimed).

I feel most like the issue is that Riot didn't 100% decide what they wanted her to do, and thus hedged on it, which makes her function significantly less well (for game health).

If the movespeed is considered necessary for some reason-- if it was, say, a fervor-style effect on Fox-Fire, it'd be significantly less bad (lockon range being not as high as Orb's throw range, it would be less effective for being useful while running away, and thus only give her the speed while in a fight).

> Sustain, poke, mobility, burst, waveclear, true damage, zone control, pick potential, strong roams, low cooldowns, etc.

-Her sustain is dependent on her spellcasts, so she's using those less effectively as a very minor tradeoff (and it isn't large enough of one) if she's maximizing her healing

-Her poke isn't as high range as others usually labelled as poke champions, though it is very *safe*; so roughly equally frustrating.

-Her waveclear requires at least two Qs unless she's exceedingly far ahead most of the time; which means it takes her measurable time (though likely, not yet enough time considering her run-in-and-out attached to it).

-True Damage really isn't a point either way if you ask me; it's just damage. She doesn't have any spell that *also* does Physical Damage nor any enhancement to increase her Physical Damage output; so she can be countered by building HP/MR like every other mage in the game.

-She can't hold a zone at all, actually. She affects the area around her strongly, but she can't incentivize everybody away from that location, instead ambushing and running (e.g. pick potential). To separate the two feels disingenuous.

-Strong roaming... like every other mage with CC in the game; or every other assassin?

> Ahri is the generalist people accuse Lee Sin of being.

This, I feel, is slightly inaccurate; but strong nonetheless. She's a particular *kind of* fighter but has a lot of outs built into her play which I feel is an active problem.

I've never seen the full implication of your anecdote happen, but that doesn't mean it doesn't. Usually, when that event occurs (Ahri kills with W-Ult-Ignite), the Ahri is:
a) Ahead / targetting a squishy with no Magic Resistance
and
b) Focusing an already weakened target.

Thus, she does need the damage offered by her skillshots.

Additionally, while her W has the highest possible damage per cast; it also puts her in range of the opponent, it is usually ranked up last (thus actually has less damage).
